original_title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - King Street to Charlton Street.
text:
(1)
Sixth Avenue Extension, east side, from King to Charlton Streets, showing 2 and 4 King Street, at and adjoining the south corner of Macdougal, and the rear of 35 and 33 Macdougal Street, frame houses with brick fronts. These two houses will later be demolished, but Nos. 37 and 39, which are hidden by 4-2 King Street, will remain.
September 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing an extended view. Shown through clearance are Nos. 34 to 20 MacDougal Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of Prince Street.
September 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

original_title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - King Street to Charlton Street.
text:
(1)
Sixth Avenue Extension, east side, from King to Charlton Streets, showing 2 and 4 King Street, at and adjoining the south corner of Macdougal, and the rear of 35 and 33 Macdougal Street, frame houses with brick fronts. These two houses will later be demolished, but Nos. 37 and 39, which are hidden by 4-2 King Street, will remain.
September 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing an extended view. Shown through clearance are Nos. 34 to 20 MacDougal Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of Prince Street.
September 1, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Sixth Avenue, west side, from King (left) to West Houston Streets. This building line was originally the westerly side of the former Congress Street. It lost its identity in 1928 on the extension of the Avenue southward. For photos of same see files under the Congress Street heading.

April 30, 1940

P. L. Sperr
